sources.title: A Girl of the Limberlost
sources.description: * Released: 1934-04-29 * Drama (Eng US) * Monogram Pictures Corporation * Cert. #190 * WRITER: Gene Stratton-Porter (Aug 1909) * PRODUCER: Wm.T. Lackey * DIRECTOR: Christy Cabanne * STARRING: Louise Dresser; Ralph Morgan; Marian Marsh; Henry B. Walthall * SYNOPSIS: Young woman faces cold neglect by her mother, who feels ruined by death of husband, who drowned in the swamp quicksand. She blames her daughter for his death, as she was giving birth to her, instead of being with him to save his life. SOURCE: Wikipedia; IMDB (Internet Movie Database) I own zero rights to this film and I upload for Educational Purposes Only for all present and future generations. The book (well worth the read!) is available free of charge at: https://archive.org/details/agirllimberlost00stragoog Doreen (def gp ddh)

sources.title: A Girl of the Limberlost
sources.description: Title: A Girl of the Limberlost Summary: Elnora Comstock is the badly abused daughter of Katherine Comstock, who blames her because her father was drowned while on the way home the night she was born. She finds her comfort with ... Directed by: Christy Cabanne Actors: Louise Dresser, Marian Marsh, Ralph Morgan Production Company: W.T. Lackey Productions Release Date: 15 October 1934 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 Elnora Comstock is the badly abused daughter of Katherine Comstock, who blames her because her father was drowned while on the way home the night she was born. She finds her comfort with Margaret and Westley Sinton, a childless neighboring couple, who help her with her school costs, as does the wealthy Mrs. Parker, who takes an interest in the talented young girl. She meets and falls in love with Phillip Ammon, the nephew of Dr. Ammon, but learns that he is already engaged. The money that Elnora has saved for her college education is stolen, and when Mrs. Comstock goes to retrieve it from a suspect, she also learns of the duplicity of her husband, who had been courting a neighboring woman on the night he drowned. She begs forgiveness of Elnora, and the romance of Elnora and Phillip also begins to flourish.

metadata.Plot: Elnora Comstock is the badly abused daughter of Katherine Comstock, who blames her because her father was drowned while on the way home the night she was born. She finds her comfort with Margaret and Westley Sinton, a childless neighboring couple, who help her with her school costs, as does the wealthy Mrs. Parker, who takes an interest in the talented young girl. She meets and falls in love with Phillip Ammon, the nephew of Dr. Ammon, but learns that he is already engaged. The money that Elnora has saved for her college education is stolen, and when Mrs. Comstock goes to retrieve it from a suspect, she also learns of the duplicity of her husband, who had been courting a neighboring woman on the night he drowned. She begs forgiveness of Elnora, and the romance of Elnora and Phillip also begins to flourish.
metadata.Actors: Louise Dresser, Marian Marsh, Ralph Morgan
